english_translation: Narrated through the chain: Uthman sent Sulayt ibn Sulayt and Abdur-Rahman ibn Attab ibn Usayd to Ibn Salam, saying: 'Go to Ibn Salam and disguise yourselves as if you are Bedouins from Atawiyya, then tell him: Unrest has befallen the people as you can see, so what do you command us?' They came to Ibn Salam and spoke to him in this manner. He said to one of them: 'You are so-and-so son of so-and-so,' and said to the other: 'You are so-and-so son of so-and-so. The Commander of the Believers sent you. Give him my greetings and inform him that he will be killed, so let him desist, for that will be stronger for his argument before Allah on the Day of Resurrection.' They came to him and informed him. Then Uthman said: 'I charge you that no one of you fights with me.' Marwan said: 'And I charge myself to fight,' so he fought and was struck upon his neck. He continued lying with his chin upon his chest until he died.

He said: And Hudhayfah said: 'Hearts have fluttered to their places. May the mother of every brave and mighty man from the Arabs be bereaved today. By Allah, nothing will come to you after this except smaller and broken matters, and the last of them will be worse.'

english_translation: Narrated from Aban: He said that Salam informed me from Abdullah ibn Rabah, saying: I and Abu Qatadah entered upon Uthman while he was besieged. We asked his permission for Hajj, and he granted us permission. We said: O Commander of the Believers, a matter concerning these people has befallen us as you can see, so what do you command us? He said: 'Hold to the congregation (Jama'ah).' We said: 'We fear that the congregation may be with those who oppose you.' He said: 'Hold to the congregation wherever it may be.' He said: We went out from him, then I met al-Hasan ibn Ali entering upon him. We returned with him to hear what he would say. He said: 'Here I am, O Commander of the Believers, command me with your command.' He said: 'Sit, O son of my brother, until Allah brings about His affair, for I have no need of the world, or he said: of fighting.'

english_translation: Narrated from al-Zuhri from Urwah, saying: I and Ubayd Allah ibn Adiyy ibn al-Khiyar entered upon Aisha. We mentioned Uthman, and she said: 'O, would that I had been something forgotten and left forgotten. By Allah, I did not violate anything concerning Uthman except that the same was violated concerning me, until if I had wished for his killing, I would have been killed.' Then she said: 'O Ubayd Allah ibn Adiyy, let not anyone deceive you after the group whom you know, for by Allah, the deeds of the companions of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ were not belittled until the readers who criticized Uthman were tested. They recited a recitation not like it, and prayed a prayer not like it, and fasted a fast not like it, and spoke a speech we cannot speak like it. When I considered the craftsmanship, I found they did not approach the companions of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. So when you hear the beautiful speech of a man, then say: "Work, and Allah will see your deeds and His Messenger and the believers" from Surah At-Tawbah, verse 105, and let not anyone deceive you.'

english_translation: Narrated from Ayyub from Abu Qilabah, that a man from Quraysh called Thumarah was in charge of San'a. When news of Uthman's killing came to him, he gave a speech and wept bitterly. When he recovered and regained consciousness, he said: 'Today the Caliphate of Prophethood has been seized from the Ummah of Muhammad ﷺ, and it has become kingship and tyranny. Whoever takes something has overpowered it.'

english_translation: Narrated from Ayyub from Abu Qilabah from Zahdim, saying: We were with Ibn Abbas one day, and he said: 'By Allah, I will surely tell you a hadith that is neither hidden secret nor open proclamation - it is not hidden so I conceal it from you, nor is it open so I preach with it. Indeed, when they attacked Uthman and killed him, I said to the son of Abu Talib: Avoid this matter, for you will be dealt with, so spare yourself. But he disobeyed me, and I do not think he will succeed. By Allah, Mu'awiyyah ibn Abu Sufyan will surely prevail over you, because Allah said: "Whoever is killed wrongfully, We have given authority to his heir" from Surah Al-Isra, verse 33. By Allah, Quraysh will surely conduct themselves among you in the manner of Persia and Rome.' He said: We said: 'What do you command us, O Ibn Abbas, if we encounter that?' He said: 'Whoever among you takes what he knows is right will be saved, and whoever abandons it while you too abandon it, will be like one of these generations that perished.'
